column1: Today we celebrate National Religious Freedom Day. Religious freedom is a foundational principle of our American government and I’m thankful that our founding fathers recognized this right and that we are able to worship freely.  #ReligiousFreedomDay https://t.co/RmvPyC5s8B

Today is National Law Enforcement Appreciation Day. Thank you to the brave men and women who put their lives on the line each and every day to protect our communities. #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay https://t.co/gFkA58m0wg
On January 2 1788 Georgia became the 4th state to ratify the U.S. Constitution. Happy Birthday to the Peach State! https://t.co/O7JjSridyl
Today Robin and I give thanks for the many blessings God bestowed upon us this year. We wish you and your family a very Happy Thanksgiving. God bless. https://t.co/0p0I5UJc9N
Today we honor those who chose to serve. Thank you for your faithful service and sacrifice. Happy Veterans Day! https://t.co/5iNjSsnRZB
Today we honor and remember. May we #NeverForget. 🇺🇸️ https://t.co/tR5Y2dnyS9
Wave 'em! Fly 'em! Salute 'em! Celebrate 'em! Honor 'em! Happy Flag Day! #FlagDay https://t.co/riUAqgznWq
Let us remember and honor those who gave all on this Memorial Day. #MemorialDay #rememberandhonor https://t.co/tTUZr7ztvz

Today we celebrate National Ag Day recognizing the hard work of all those Georgians involved in American agriculture. Agriculture is essential to everyday life and today we celebrate the individuals who dedicate their lives to feeding the world. #AgDay19 #thankafarmer https://t.co/krVBp6vftC

Today we celebrate the birthday of our nation’s first president George Washington and honor all of America’s presidents for their leadership to this country. Happy President's Day! https://t.co/29Tp2XiHv1
